txt.en: 'For the protection of all Shagâna.'
'Ambarûl stands with you, Mizâdi.'
'I swear it.'
'That is not a bad plan. Without grain stores, none of our soldiers cannot stay in the field for long.'
'Now you want to work together? What about when we begged you for help, when Bârshud was overrunning our fortifications?'
'Oho, I believe you could indeed! But for many, their growling belly would betray them long before a fortnight ends.'
'You are impossible Mizâdi. A selfish child.'
'Is it agreed then, that this is our plan of action?'
'You did not answer our pleas, and for that you will have to answer our dead.'
Gather the map from near the Subuzûri.
'Amalíbi?'
'You were like a moth to a flame, Mizâdi. He played you for a fool.'
'How dare you treat with me like this?!'
Spread the map out on the table.
'Then we must reinforce our position outside Garash Kâru, and seize it once we have sufficient numbers.'
'If it's a choice between Mizâdi and Barshud, I suppose that's no choice at all.'
Listen to the conversation.
Ascend the stairs to find the other prisoners
'You may be fairweather allies, but yes, we will go along with your plan, Mizâdi. But don't push your luck.'
'The Khûd is vast and full of empty areas.'
Speak with Mizâdi in the hall.
You have brought the leaders of Ambarûl, Khûd Zagin, and Imhûlar together in Iridír. Mizâdi has much to do before Girhâzi and Amalíbi trust her or her leadership.
Join Mizâdi around the war table.
Speak with Razâl inside the Angar Aragín
Listen to the conversation
'I could fight for a fortnight without food.'
Gather the map from near the Subuzûri
Spread the map out on the table
Listen to the conversation
Speak with Mizâdi in the hall
Listen to the conversation

'There's no telling what we may find here. I believe they bring the sacrifices upstairs to one of their dark altars. That is likely where we'll find Numûru and any other unfortunates they've gathered.'
Join Mizâdi around the war table
Listen to Mizâdi
Listen to the conversation
Speak with Mizâdi
'I have called this war council to discuss how we all can work together to defeat this Bârshud.'
'I may be Queen of Fools, but at least I have a homeland.'
'I am not wandering the barrens, Queen of the Wastes.'
'[placeholder], I would speak with you briefly.'
'We know not where Bârshud is, just that he controls much of Khûd Zagin.'
'His Umûn admitted to our friend here that Bârshud has designs on Ambarûl, and particularly its stores of grain.'
Listen to Mizâdi.
'The alliance proffered here is uneasy, and fragile, but it is there. Let us venture back outside into Iridír. We have preparations to make.'

'Thank you for coming, friend. It is quite the aid, let me tell you. I know not how to make my words persuade others, I haven't the talent. What's worse, it seems my passion has gotten the better of me again. I wish I had not said what I did to Amalíbi.\n\n'Could you gather the map from near the Subuzûri guard and spread it on the table? Now that we are discussing tactics and troop movements I feel much more in my element.'
'I believe that Bârshud intends to seize Ambarûl in order to starve the rest of Shagâna.'
Listen to the conversation.
'Yes. I agree. We should eliminate his foothold within Ambarûl and then work to push back his forces from north to south in Khûd Zagin.'
'Since arriving here, I have instructed three scouting parties to start searching for large Ekhamâti encampments in Khûd Zagin.'
'I swear it.'
'I believe our best course of action is to gather our forces here, resupply, then assault Garash Kâru once all our forces arrive in Iridír.'
'Meanwhile my scouts will search for Bârshud's location, and if we find him...'
'I say we launch a counter-attack with the aim to cut off the snake's head.'
Listen to the conversation.
'Without Bârshud, I believe the Ordâkhai will lose their nerve and return south, likely back to this Hûl in Ordâkh Bârshud mentioned.'
'We need to focus on the matter at hand. We are all here now, with our skin, and that is what matters.'
'He will lose his army and his head in one fell stroke.'
'Mizâdi, many say you are a skilled tactician.'
Speak with Mizâdi in the war room.
Instance: The Sickle, the Lotus, and the Lion
'It is agreed then. Such as it is.'
'Why don't you tell us what you know of this Bârshud and his army?'
'An alliance between the Sickle, the Lotus, and the Lion, for the protection of all Shagâna.'
'He has not been able to seize much farmland.'
TBD
'I swear it.'
'The Dumûri halted his advance at Garash Kâru, within Ambarûl but far to the south.'
Listen to the conversation.
